messages.content: WebUI Monaco Prompt is an extension for AUTOMATIC1111's stable-diffusion-webui and ComfyUI that allows editing prompts using the Monaco Editor, an editor implementation used in VSCode.
What are the features of webui-monaco-prompt?
WebUI Monaco Prompt provides features such as VIM key binding support, syntax highlighting for standard and Dynamic Prompts notations, and auto-complete support.
How can you install webui-monaco-prompt for AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI?

To install webui-monaco-prompt for AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI, enter the URL of this repository 'https://github.com/Taremin/webui-monaco-prompt' in the 'Install from URL' section of stable-diffusion-webui.
What are the two methods to install webui-monaco-prompt for ComfyUI (Experimental)?

The two methods to install webui-monaco-prompt for ComfyUI (Experimental) are: 1. Clone this repository to 'custom_nodes', or 2. Enter the URL of this repository in the 'Install via Git URL' in the 'ComfyUI Manager Menu'.

WebUI Monaco Prompt reads 'danbooru.csv' and 'extra-quality-tags.csv' by default for auto-complete. When '<' is entered, it shows only the candidates of Extra Networks (HN/LoRA/LyCORIS). LyCORIS is available when a1111-sd-webui-lycoris extension is installed.
What should be done if the HTML structure changes or existing features are modified in AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI?
If the HTML structure changes or existing features are modified in AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI, it is recommended to temporarily stop using webui-monaco-prompt as it may become unavailable.
How can you add additional CSV files for auto-complete in webui-monaco-prompt?

To add additional CSV files for auto-complete in webui-monaco-prompt, add the file to the 'csv' directory of this extension. For A1111, reload the application. For ComfyUI, click 'Refresh' to make it available.
